intro: Eriochiton, commonly known as the goldenbush, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Scrophulariaceae. It consists of several species native to the Americas, particularly in regions of the United States and Mexico. These plants are characterized by their showy, often yellow or orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The leaves are typically opposite and lance-shaped, with a somewhat hairy texture. Eriochiton species are often found in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing their adaptability to arid environments.
